titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Church Extension Board of the Presbytery of Brooklyn-Nassau records 1978.027
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-17T14:22-0500

did.unittitle: Church Extension Board of the Presbytery of Brooklyn-Nassau records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: United Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. Presbytery of Brooklyn-Nassau. Extension Board.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Church Extension Board of the Presbytery of Brooklyn-Nassau records, 1978.027, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Church Extension Board of the Presbytery of Brooklyn-Nassau, Inc. was an agency created in 1914 to house the Presbytery's records, to aid in the establishment of new churches, and to give assistance to existing churches. The agency was located on Clinton Street in Brooklyn Heights.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: R.H. Woodman (1841-1943), born in Brooklyn, was organist and choirmaster at First Presbyterian Church in Brooklyn Heights from 1880 to 1941.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Church Extension Board of the Presbytery of Brooklyn-Nassau records span the period 1889 to 1962 and measure 0.25 linear feet. The records include financial documents and minutes of the Church Extension Board, a choir roll book, and letters written by R. H. Woodman.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
